sentences.english: He was in such a hurry to get out that he barged into a passer-by.
sentences.chinese: 他急急忙忙地往外走，竟與一位行人撞了個滿懷。

sentences.english: The enemy scurried way , with the tail between their legs.
sentences.chinese: 敵人急急忙忙夾着尾巴逃走了。

sentences.english: She rustled up a supper for us.
sentences.chinese: 她急急忙忙給我們弄了一頓晚飯。

sentences.english: I was late for the school bus and rushing to get ready.
sentences.chinese: 我晚了，急急忙忙地準備着趕校車。

sentences.english: Her daughters were eagerly called to partake of her joy.
sentences.chinese: 她喜出望外，急急忙忙喚女兒們來分享她這種愉快。

sentences.english: People are in a great hurry to move away the bricks and stones.
sentences.chinese: 人們正急急忙忙地搬開磚頭和石頭。
爲什麼生活總是急急忙忙的？

sentences.english: I dissuaded him from rushing in to submit his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 我勸他不要急急忙忙遞交辭職書。

sentences.english: I believe that the girl married up.
sentences.chinese: 我以爲那個女孩急急忙忙地結婚了。

sentences.english: You run around in a tizzy trying to do all those last minute things you procrastinated about the night before.
sentences.chinese: 你急急忙忙去做那些你前一晚上推脫沒做的瑣事。

sentences.english: They are afraid to be late with hurry up.
sentences.chinese: 他們急急忙忙地趕路，唯恐遲到。

sentences.english: You hang up hurriedly and attend to baby,crockery,etc.
sentences.chinese: 你急急忙忙掛上電話，趕去照顧孩子和陶器。

sentences.english: The boy rushed off as soon as his father gave him permission.
sentences.chinese: 一得到父親的許可，這個男孩就急急忙忙地跑掉了。

sentences.english: In some way, in the rush to get out of the building I got separated from my mother.
sentences.chinese: 我急急忙忙衝出大樓的時候不知怎麼就和媽媽走散了。

sentences.english: Below, a myriad myriad waves hastening, lifting up their necks.
sentences.chinese: 俯瞰，浪無數急急忙忙逐，伸頸回眸走。

sentences.english: I came out in such a hurry without looking into the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 我急急忙忙地就出來了，也沒照照鏡子。

definition: in a great rush/in a flurry
to need the toilet/urinary or defecatory urgency
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
